poemContent: Burrowing into the sun-hidden bush, Deep in the realm where the sun don’t shine, Silent, sly, slithering, hushed As all shifty know it’s a rue; a mere lie. Cringing into the thicks of it; seemingly harmless. Straight out of the bush, but back into the darkness. And right again out, as soon gone in, Just leaving the marks, where shifty will had been. 
